contentList.content: *With all Minthara's hate, you wonder if her cerebro-spinal fluid will be bitter to sip?*
*You could set the slander right at last - tell the world every bite was perfect.*
*All this stimulating conversation leaves you hungry.*
*This is highly illogical... There are plenty of other craniums awaiting your suction, and this is a prize ally.*
*Every time Halsin speaks of balance, your thoughts cannot behave.*
*What better reunion than this eternal bond?*
*You would save his temporal lobe for last, if you were to eat Gale.*
*The buffet table at this party bears pie, punch and cocktail sausages.*
*That will make her especially chewy - just how you like a cortex to be.*
*And besides - this brain before you - its endorphins are in a joyous flow.*
Glance around - is there anything else you could eat?
*Weary Jaheira. Over time, her stresses may have shrunk her hippocampus, making its taste more intense.*
Begin your harvest.
*There are cruel rumours spread, that Minsc may once have suffered injury to his brain.*
*The hormone of love is swelling somewhere in this skull.*
*Wyll's frontal lobe, which processes his judgement and measured words, would be a delicacy befitting his nobility.*
*You only dream of what cerebellum tastes like, when it sends the signals to his vestibular system to keep him from wobbling.*
*No respite shall be had at this pitiful smorgasbord.*
*His parietal lobe - which controls his sense of touch - will be an aphrodisiac in your maw.*
*To speak is not enough. You wish to explore the brain of your friend with your beak.*
*It is a wonderful scent - the odour of friendship.*
Resist the craving.
*On consuming a brain, you become one with its owner. Every memory blends with yours.*
*And besides - the hypothalamus in this brain before you is secreting.*
*Language. Learning. Memory. He must have quite the fine example.*
*Think of Shadowheart's cerebellum, which controls her dextrous hands. Any ritual caster must have a tightly commanded hindbrain.*
*You consider Karlach's brain stem - the stalk meant to regulate her body's temperature. Will it come pre-cooked?*
*Astarion's sweet brain may be a bit less wrinkled than the rest, but you hunger for its teasing cells.*
*Wyll's frontal lobe, which processes his judgement and measured words, would be a delicacy fit for a Grand Duke.*
*You shall dine well tonight.*
*Lae'zel's motor cortex - that which controls her fine movements - will be harshly disciplined.*
You are hungry.
You are hungry.
Yes... help me... I don't want to hurt anyone...
I am. And I will take what I want.
Focus on me. I will siphon off as much of the craving as I can.
Relax... breathe... it will pass.
This is an ally! A friend! You have nothing to gain by consuming them!
You're right... I was distracted by how delicious they would be.
I have everything to gain. Their thoughts, memories, personality... I will give them all a magnificent home within me.
Yes. And you would turn everyone here against us. We would lose everything we had built over our journey against the Netherbrain.
*A phantom presence wraps itself around you. It is peace, warmth, care... and the strength to resist.*
Do you not wish to partake? This is what we are. This is what we do.
No, it is not. A brain's aptitude for consumption is made of far more than its taste. Do not be blinded by desire.
*The beast within you is losing, but it has not withdrawn.*
I am a mind flayer. I will consume my prey. And I will not let you control me.
I suppose you're right. Another will serve as sustenance.
You are being irrational! Do not do this!
It's alright. You are still learning how to control yourself.
Yes, they will.
Your control is improving. You resisted your urge well.
It was foolish of us to hope that the skeleton would provide for his aberrant guests. He has always been vocal about his distaste of illithids.
Fortunately, these wilds are littered with suitable meals. We will find something to eat on the way home.
That was too close. I almost gave in.
You didn't. That's all that matters now. We will be better prepared for contact with our non-illithid allies in the future.
Thank you for the help. You definitely made that easier for me.
But for now - let us enjoy the rest of the party.
And I'm sure the hunt will make for a deeply satisfying meal.
You are welcome, my love. We will be better prepared for contact with our non-illithid allies in the future.
That felt like a missed opportunity. I wish I had done it.
That is your hunger whispering to you. You have the strength to silence it.
My love...!
FOOL! You have cost us dearly!
I'm glad you saw reason.
I don't think I needed any help. I resisted easily.
Perhaps. But knowing when to use caution instead of arrogance is a valuable skill.
Resist the craving. Let it dissolve in your connection to the Emperor.
The Emperor is psychically reducing your urge.
The Emperor is psychically reducing your urge.
The Emperor is psychically reducing your urge.
The Emperor is psychically reducing your urge.
Yes. What do I do?
I'm mighty enough to resist. Watch!
My love, this is not the time for theatrics. I know how your mind feels when you want to feed. Let me help you.
I'm not being theatrical! I'll be fine.
Actually, you're right. I'm hungrier than I thought.
This is an unnecessary risk. Hubris will not reward you anything.
The Emperor is psychically reducing your urge.
Well, it seems like you are in control. While your restraint is impressive, I must again remind you of the dangers of overconfidence.
*Your attention returns to your companion, who remains oblivious to the exchange of thoughts that took place before them.*
The Emperor is psychically reducing your urge.
You told me to embrace my hunger before I consumed Orpheus. You are being hypocritical.
No, I'm not. That was a necessary assimilation. Your hunger is not fit for every non-illithid, especially those we value.
Don't worry, I'll be fine.
My love, you are salivating over an ally's brain. I know how your mind feels when you want to feed. Let me help you.
Really, I'm not that hungry.
Good... it has passed.
...It hurts to see you struggle with this.
Very well, love. I trust you.
I haven't known such peaceful sleep for a long time - and I greatly enjoyed sharing it with you outside of a dream world.
But... I must ask...
Remember: you are not alone. Whenever you require assistance, I will provide it.
reaction
Thank you. I appreciate your kindness.
That is disappointing. What will you do instead?
Do you have any ideas for how we should organize the Knights?
On the docks, you mentioned we should think bigger with our plans. What did you have in mind?
Would you like to rebuild the Knights of the Shield with me? Together, we would do wonderful things.
On the docks, you said you did not want to help rebuild the Knights. Does that mean you no longer wish for a partnership?
make a giant spy network, control the Sword Coast
grow our spy network
The illithids that survived the battle are free now. They need help, or the Baldurians will hunt them down and slaughter them.
We should use the power of Orpheus to free illithids and build a colony of renegade mind flayers.
We must grow our influence across the Sword Coast. Nothing will happen without our knowledge.
You know how to run an organization far better than I do. You should take the lead.
Of course not. You are far too afraid to weaponize our illithid superiority. A partnership with you would only hold me back.
I'm sorry, but I have other things to attend to. This is where we part ways.
I understand, but I can't say I'm not disappointed. I greatly enjoyed our time together. Where will you go?
I've given it some thought, and I changed my mind. I would like to run the Knights with you.
I am pleased to hear that.
Running the Knights of the Shield with you is a fine idea.
Would you like to go adventuring? There is so much out there. I would love to see it all with you.
We are mind flayers. There is so much more we could accomplish together.
Then let us begin. Is there anything you would like to prioritize?
Your ambition is admirable. What did you have in mind?
Now that we are alone, and the fires of battle have cooled...
How is your body? Your mind?
You know, illithid art and music is fascinating. I'd like to learn to play the bonethriven.
That is a wonderful idea. Knowledge on its playing and construction, if not a bonethriven itself, should be housed in Moonrise Towers.
If it does not house a bonethriven, it should at least contain information on its construction and playing technique.
I am relieved your bardic spirits remain high... I greatly enjoy your artistic pursuits. Are you feeling well physically, though?
I felt fine at first... but after seeing what the others think of me, I might have made a mistake.
The thoughts and emotions of everyone are too loud. My head can't contain them all.
Your concern is unnecessary. I'm a mind flayer; when I broke from that old flesh, I became perfect.
Don't worry. I feel amazing.
This is already a lot to take in. My studies of illithids have evidently been lacking.
I'm ghaik. The enemy of my old people. And I wouldn't have it any other way.
This ghaikskin disgusts me. I should not have allowed this to happen.
I just cured myself of one Urge and gave myself another. That's not an upgrade.
This body freed me from my heart. I'm alive! I'm happy!
Few survive encounters with our kind - at least with their minds intact. Those who do rarely get close enough to truly study us.
Many of the "facts" about us are simply conjecture and hearsay. I look forward to rectifying any incorrect beliefs you may hold about me and yourself.
I much prefer this body over my old Urge. I am no longer indebted to any "gods."
Good morning, my dear.
Good morning, my dear.
In time, you will find that your hunger is much easier to control then your old murderous instincts.
Yes. I'm happy for you; for the first time in your life, the path ahead is of your own making.
It's alright... your discomfort is natural. With time, you will see that form is meaningless... a lesson the rest of the githyanki have yet to learn.
I'm happy to hear that. Most githyanki resist change, even if it is for the better.
I should have let you wield the stones. I don't want to eat brains, and this body feels... wrong.
Do not feel guilty about your diet. It is who you are - and you are glorious.
Your discomfort is natural. Though remember: they are not illithid, and thus are in no position to judge you.
That outlook is very... traditional.
I'm glad you are taking to your new form well. Most do not... not at first.
We will find a resonance stone for you. It will assist you while you learn to tune out others.
So am I. You deserve this.
Unforeseen challenges are sure to arise. Few illithids never know the guidance enthrallment offers.
I think this was a mistake. Many of the instruments I know are nigh on impossible to play with this biology.
Humanoid society is ignorant to illithid culture's artistic richness. There are numerous instruments tailored to your new form.
If you'd like, we can search for new outlets for your bardic talents. I will not see your passions lost.
You have only begun to glimpse the wonders of your illithidness. I am eager to teach you.
Why am I so small? Illithids are supposed to be fearsome and majestic. I'm pathetic and gross.
Ceremorphosis is complex, and no immediate form is guaranteed. You simply need time to develop.
After everything you have done for me, it is the least I can do for you.
I must know how you feel physically, though.
Do not fear. If you maintain a healthy diet, you will grow to be as imposing as any illithid.
With that said... we should turn to business.
*The mind flayer breathes. You have not known it for long, but you know it is thinking. Deeply.*
It's over. We are free. And with Orpheus's power, I never need fear enslavement again.
I said this after our victory, but I feel I must say it again. You are glorious. I am infinitely grateful to you.
You have given me a third beginning. I am infinitely grateful.
*You realize - you have never seen it look peaceful. Until now.*
But... I am illithid. You are not. This difference complicates our partnership.
I should have evolved when I had the chance. Your mental absence is more painful than I expected.
If you are serious... I am able to accomodate such a desire.
I took this from the nautiloid and have nurtured it since, priming it for your use if you ever desired to evolve.
I would like that.
Why did you keep this from me?
Oh... now that you mention it, I don't think that's a good idea.
The evolution cannot be undone. This step should only be taken after careful consideration - I feared telling you would negatively influence your analysis.
Since your last tadpole was destroyed, this one must be implanted.
I understand. I will continue to look after this should evolution once again tempt you.
However, this brings us back to our problem of differing forms.
When you are ready, and after the tadpole has afixed itself, I will emulate the transformation command.
I know. I'm ready.
I changed my mind.
Very well. Come here.
Remember: the path you are about to walk cannot be retread. You will be illithid for the rest of your life. Shall I insert the tadpole now?
*The tadpole screeches in eagerness. You are brought back to the nautiloid - where this all began.*
*This time, though... it is guided to its mark by a gentle hand.*
*Too long... too long has the tadpole waited for such a succulent prize. It will only take a moment until it is in place.*
Its eagerness for communion matches your own. Open your mind to me - I will dull the pain as much as I am able.
Yes.
Could I be a partial illithid again?
Can we just leave it there, actually?
Netherese tadpoles have proven resilient, but that strength has only been tested over a span of months, not years.
We can leave it there for now. But if negative effects begin to surface, you must transform.
Very well.
Very well. Open your mind to me; I will dull the pain as much as I am able.
*The boundary between thought and feeling is gone. Your mind and body are as one - bristling with concentrated cerebral energy.*
How do you feel?
Fool. Your only worth is as food. Eat its brain.
I feel amazing. It's a relief to hear you again.
I heard how horrible ceremorphosis is... but that was worse.
I'm really hungry.
I mourned the loss of our mental connection. With it restored... and the hope that it could be permanent... I'm happy.
Since that is taken care of... we should turn to business.
Once we are done here, a meal should be easy to find - and I will make sure it's a satisfying one.
Yes. Its... physicality stays with you. I'm glad it was fast for you, though. Most suffer for days.
I enjoy your partial illithid visage.
This is... glorious. The power is delicious.
It is. Even now, I have yet to tire of its wonder.
But... how is your heart?
*Your engine flares - as if immolating its way out of your chest. You know: the inferno is here.*
Concentrate. Try to silence the fire raging within you.
I... think my time is up. I'm burning.
Even without our mental connection, I can feel your desperation... your engine has reached its end.
I had hoped for a miracle. In my centuries as an illithid, you are the only person who has truly cared for me. I don't want to see you burn away.
Please... return to Avernus. You deserve a life.
No. I swore never to return. Just... be with me when it happens, okay?
I can't... not alone. Will you come with me?
I didn't anticipate this ending in a journey to the Hells...
I have seen your might firsthand. Your strength has only improved since the nautiloid - Zariel will never hurt you again. You must return.
I'm sorry, I... I can't ask that of you. You don't deserve Avernus.
Yes... with you, I can make it. I could survive.
Dearest... it does not matter what I deserve. I am not the one who is dying.
When we find a way to fix your heart, we will return to this world together. I will not allow you to be trapped in the Hells for the rest of your life.
Perhaps your heart is of a similar structure. Perhaps if it were housed in an illithid body, it would be stabilized.
This seems way too risky. What if it doesn't work?
Then we will have exhausted all possibilities. We will not live with the uncertainty that there was an alternative.
The Steel Watchers saw you as one of their own... and our visit to the Foundry revealed that they were made of illithid technology.
Hells... never thought I'd actually become a mind flayer, but I'm willing to try it if it could save me a return trip to Avernus.
The more I think about it, the more I wish I did transform.
The thought means a lot... but I want to go out as myself.
You will be yourself! You could live!
I'm sorry... the thought of losing you was more powerful than I anticipated.
When you eat a brain, you absorb its memories, right? If I'm going to die anyway, you should eat mine. You'll never be alone again.
It's okay, little squiddie. Please just... be with me.
I will stay by your side until the end.
That is... very selfless. Are you sure this is what you want?
Yes. And you'd better do it now, before it gets burned.
Honestly, I have no idea. I... I think it's better if I just... burn.
I understand. I will stay by your side until the end.
And now... I can make sure my little squiddie will be okay too.
I can finally let go.
I love you.
I'm glad to hear that.
Go for it.
This is too much... I'm just going to let the engine burn.
You could live!
It is ready. I will transform you.
This is... glorious. The power is delicious.
I'm hungry. And I think you will make a fine meal. Eat its brain.
I... I think it worked! My heart is cooled! I'm going to live! But I'm really hungry.
I... I think it worked! My heart is cooled! I'm going to live!
*A tidal wave of the Emperor's relief drowns your consciousness.*
Sorry... I didn't mean to overwhelm you. I'm... happy.
We should turn to business.
We are free. And with Orpheus's power, we never need fear enslavement again.
It's over. We are free. And with Orpheus's power, we never need fear enslavement again.
I've never cared about your form, and I never will. You are beautiful.
Now that I'm free and our mental connection is broken... I think I like it better away from you.
A partnership with a mind flayer is too beneficial to let go.
I enjoyed the sex, but I don't want a partnership with a monster.
I see. You hid your cold heart from me well.
Rational, as always.
Rational.
Raphael is far too great a threat to Zariel's rule for her to hunt you. You must return.
We should move on to business.
Would you like to go adventuring? There is so much out there. I would love to see it all with you.
I think we should part ways.
I think we should part ways.
Somewhere peaceful, I hope.
anti shar line
I would like to go home to Waterdeep. It has been to long since I have sat next to a warm fire with a good book.
I must flee. Vlaakith's kith'raki will never cease their hunt for me.
I am a warrior. I hunt and kill. I will not be tethered to this city.
My duty is to protect the Realms. I will cleanse it of the fiends that plague it. This countenance will be a perfect disguise.
I have to lead the city. The Grand Duke cannot be seen with the Knights.
I cannot abandon the Sword Coast. My duty is to its people.
I have power to consolidate. This city is mine.
I will return to the shadows. It's what I know. Maybe one day though... I'll rise to more.
The shadows. A place where I can prepare to face Cazador.
Dealing with the Urge was exhausting. I'd like to get away from here and find somewhere I can relax.
I doubt rebuilding is among the Knights' priorities. I'd like to help directly with recovery efforts.
Our adventure inspired me. I want to see all the secrets the Realms have to offer.
My duty is to Lady Shar. My devotion is eternal, even now.
I wish I could stay with you, but I must take care of my parents.
I will miss you. The memories we created rank among my most prized possessions.
If you would ever like to visit... do not hesitate to come find me. You are welcome here.
Goodbye, my friend. I wish you great fortune in your newfound freedom.
Dealing with the Urge was exhausting. I'd like to get away from here and find somewhere I can relax.
I doubt rebuilding is among the Knights' priorities. Even if I can't contribute directly, there is much I can do from the Undercity.
Our adventure inspired me. I want to see all the secrets the Realms have to offer.
The shadows. I may be a mind flayer now, but Cazador will still hunt for me. I must be ready to face him.
I will return to the shadows. It's what I know. Maybe one day though... I'll rise to more.
I have power to consolidate. This city is mine.
I cannot abandon the Sword Coast. My duty is to its people, even as an illithid.
My duty is to protect the Realms. I will cleanse it of the fiends that plague it.
I am a warrior. I hunt and kill. I will not be tethered to this city.
I must flee. Vlaakith's kith'raki will never cease their hunt for me, especially since I am ghaik now.
I would like to go home to Waterdeep. It has been to long since I have sat next to a warm fire with a good book.
My duty is to Lady Shar. I must guide her cloister.
I wish I could stay with you, but I must take care of my parents.
I'm tired of danger and the wilds. I just want to find somewhere to relax.
I'm tired of danger and the wilds. I just want to find somewhere to relax.
Very well. Though I fear alone you will be far easier prey for Vlaakith than you would be under the protection of the Knights.
Very well. I am glad you will be close.
Your concern for them is touching.
Very well. Please remember though - appearance does not make one a monster.
Understood. There is still room to work together, though. Our combined power would greatly benefit the city.
I see. A struggle between us would not be good for this city.
Very well. The Knights are at your disposal should you require them.
Actually... would you like to go adventuring? There is so much out there. I would love to see it all with you.
Actually... would you like to go adventuring? There is so much out there. I would love to see it all with you.
I have avoided adventure since my transformation. I believed I had lost all interest in it.
But... I was wrong. My love of the unknown never faded. Instead, it was missing one essential component.
Someone to share it with.
Now that I have you, my dear, I am ready to answer exploration's call once more.
Wherever we go, whatever we do - experiencing it with you will be the greatest honor of my life.
Running the Knights of the Shield with you is a fine idea.
We should make bigger plans. There is so much more we could accomplish together.
I'm sorry, but I have other things to attend to. This is where we part ways.
I am rational. Irresponsible aggression will only lead to your death. If you let power blind you, you are no better than the Chosen.
What will you do instead?
I've given it some thought, and I changed my mind. I would like to run the Knights with you.
We should use the power of Orpheus to free illithids and build a colony of renegade mind flayers.
We must grow our influence across the Sword Coast. Nothing will happen without our knowledge.
The illithids that survived the battle are free now. They need help, or the Baldurians will hunt them down and slaughter them.
You know how to run an organization far better than I do. You should take the lead.
Indeed. They will be valuable allies, and service to the Knights will give them purpose.
Most likely fled to the sewers. We should find them quickly - they are sure to be confused, desperate... and hungry.
Instructing the newly transformed and acclimating the old to freedom will be challenging... but worth it.
To business, then.
Together, we have already accomplished more than I ever dared dream of. With our shackles broken, nothing will stand in our way.
And I must say... sharing a mindspace with you is a privilege. In the centuries since my transformation, you are the one who has made my heart shine brightest.
And I must say... waking up beside you is a privilege. In the centuries since my transformation, you are the one who has made my heart shine brightest.
Let us begin, my dear.
That... is quite the challenge. And an enticing one.
I have already created one city. Now, I will forge another - with you by my side.
We must start slowly - choose a location, enlist builders, acquire a supply of sustenance...
Once the foundations are set, we will proceed to liberation. Choosing candidates will be dangerous - recruiting those who do not desire freedom will do more harm than good.
I would enjoy building a sanctuary for those like us. Renegade illithids are scorned by all - we deserve a place where we can be ourselves.
I would enjoy building a sanctuary for those like me. Renegade illithids are scorned by all - we deserve a place where we can be ourselves.
Our combined intellect will surely make that goal attainable. Once we seize this city... the Coast will be ours.
Once we seize this city... the Coast will be ours.
I think we should part ways.
The githyanki know of us. They will never let mind flayers run an organization as powerful as ours will be. We should strike them first.
The githyanki know of us. They will never let a mind flayer run an organization as powerful as ours will be. We should strike them first.
We should build an alliance with the Zhentarim. And if they don't cooperate... well, being illithid gives us a mental edge.
We should build an alliance with the Zhentarim. And if they don't cooperate... well, you being an illithid gives us a mental edge.
We should build an alliance with the Guild. And if they don't cooperate... well, being illithid gives us a mental edge.
We should build an alliance with the Guild. And if they don't cooperate... well, you being an illithid gives us a mental edge.
Starving... but I think it worked!
Once we are done here, a meal should be easy to find - and I will make sure it's a satisfying one.
*An invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*
*One day, Halsin returns from a patrol of the borders with a letter held in his jaw. You read it to him, as you scratch behind his ear.*
For with thine bond, together thou hast kept the Wheel of Fate spinning, when it threatened to halt.
*Your life is your own now, and you are already becoming someone new.*
*That's why you're going back to where all of this began, answering an invitation to gather with your allies and friends.*
*Six months have passed since you defeated the Netherbrain, and since then you have seen more of life than you ever thought possible.*
*Your heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a short time, but it might burst with joy to feel the comforts of home, if just for an evening.*
*One among you could not truly attend, but the pull of Withers' magic called you still. Listen and enjoy, though you'll be little more than a breeze ruffling your companions' hair.*
*Who are you? What are you?*
*She always listens, and she always replies, leading you to new adventures and enlightenment.*
*As it is, you'll gather in a familiar place, and one altogether more suitable for such joyful reflection.*
*An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*
*Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*
Cladden with love, thou sundered the greater evils that attempted to rot away this realm.
*The victory that enabled the war against Vlaakith's tyranny. You cannot be there in person, but you shall be there nonetheless.*
*But whenever he looks into your eyes, or up at the stars while he sits by your side, you know the answer.*
*One night, a courier arrived with a letter addressed to 'Shadowheart'. A name few call you anymore.*
*You have made a fortress in the Underdark, along with other outcast vampire spawn. It is not civilised, it is not safe, but it is home.*
*He requested your attendance in Faerun - a chance to reflect on your triumph over the Absolute.*
*The victory that enabled the war against Vlaakith's tyranny. You cannot be there in person, but you shall be there nonetheless.*
*He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*
*But you had nothing to fear. This was the one message you had hoped to receive - an invitation to meet with your friends and allies.*
*So once again you return to the place where you formed your first memories.*
*You are greeted as a saviour, a champion, a hero... but sometimes you feel like something else entirely. An adventurer, a traveller, a survivor.*
*When the invitation came, you were hip-deep in lemure slime, swarmed by hellwasps, and about to drive the killing blow on a magma claw.*
*He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*
*The city needs Grand Duke Ravengard more than ever. The city needs you.*
*Your mind has voyaged to the limits of existence, communing with entities unique and wondrous, but something always calls it back.*
*Six months from the fall of the Netherbrain, you and Astarion were hosting a grand masquerade in the refurbished ballroom of Cazador's Palace.*
*Now, you must leave them for a brief while, and return to the surface, for you have received an invitation to celebrate upon familiar grounds.*
*The gathering will not be in the city that you saved though. It will be where your adventures first began.*
*He requested your attendance in Faerun, to gather with your friends and allies, those who stood against the Absolute at your side.*
*Cutting through the dreadful buzz of the wasps and the screams of the damned, a familiar, comforting voice echoed in your mind - Withers.*
*But whenever he looks into your eyes, or up at the stars while he sits by your side, you know the answer.*
*An invitation to a celebration, for those who stood against the Netherbrain, those who thwarted the Grand Design.*
*To project your image through the cosmos... it can be done, with the aid of your allies, the mages of Xamvadi'm.*
*An invitation to a gathering of your friends and allies, those who stood with you against the Absolute.*
*You are - and yet, you are not. You are an ascended soul, Vlaakith's favoured - yet nothing but a mote floating between planes.*
*Wyll has personally handled the rebuilding of the city, and the recovery of its people. The scars run deep, but Baldur's Gate will wear them proudly.*
*An invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*
*It is an invitation to a celebration for those who stood against the Absolute.*
*You and Shadowheart found your peace, in a country farmstead with a pack of pets, and a garden of night orchids.*
Though thou wert drawn far apart in the months after the collapse of the Absolute.
*While navigating the disordered environs of Limbo, you and Lae'zel heard the summons.*
*Six months from the fall of the Netherbrain, you were hosting a grand masquerade in the refurbished ballroom of Cazador's Palace.*

Commoners pose no threat to us. Let them come.

If someone goes missing every now and then, it might scare them off. And we'll get food, thralls, and new illithids.
I hope you're right. Perhaps the taboo of the Absolute will prevent them from moving into the tower.
Yes. If we announce our presence early, Halsin should be able to convince the people of Reithwin to leave us alone.
Arrogance is a risk. But... you're right. They are no match for a colony of illithids, even a small one like ours.
If they discover us after we take someone, they will attack. I fear that strategy is too risky.
So... Scratch found the Astral Prism. How resourceful...
I hope what the tressym said about your form does not bother you. She is ignorant, like all who believe such things.
The tressym does not keep her opinions to herself. A strategy that will not gain her many allies.
It's been six months, but things like that still hurt.
I don't care about others' opinions.
I'm glad to hear that.
I understand. I still have not developed immunity to such comments, and I have been a mind flayer for centuries.
So... Lae'zel accomplished her dream - to serve the githyanki queen to her end. A purpose shared by many illithids living under elder brains.
Though unlike them, this was her choice. I'm happy for her.
How was this her choice? She and all githyanki are brainwashed to love Vlaakith.
How was this her choice? She and all githyanki are brainwashed to love Vlaakith.

I don't think being consumed was what she had in mind.
I don't think being consumed was what she had in mind.

So am I.
So am I.
In her final moments, she knew only glory.
Say nothing.
Say nothing.

We should consider helping Lae'zel attack that githyanki outpost. It would be a thrilling adventure.
Lae'zel has seized her future - no longer is she any monarch's pawn.
Volo's tall tales will distract the public from our real plans. It is best to humor him.
Volo's embellishments are... excessive. Before my transformation, I might have approved of them... now, I'm not so sure.
It is good to see Shadowheart enjoying her freedom. I hope Selûne treats her better than Shar did.
It is good to see Shadowheart enjoying her freedom. She deserves a peaceful life after everything she went through.
Minsc continues to get himself into trouble. I'm glad our alliance with him proved more fruitful then getting us captured.
As unpredictable as Minsc is, he has captured the Zhentarim's attention. That could be beneficial for our alliance with the Guild.
Minsc's antics have jeopardized our alliance with the Zhentarim... we must ensure that they do not learn that he was freed on our behalf.
So, Minsc is the one guarding the illithid technology... we will need to find a way past him if the Guild does not agree to let us have it.
As unpredictable as Minsc is, his continued operation in Baldur's Gate could get in our way. We might have to deal with him in the future... forcefully.
Minsc continues to fascinate me. I wonder what he would be like as an illithid...
Our alliance with the Zhentarim puts us on the opposite side of Minsc... I expect the Guild to use him against us. We must be ready for that.
You decided to join the Harpers? An interesting strategy... I suppose it will be good to have a foothold in such a powerful organization.
You decided to join the Harpers? We will be far from here soon. I'm not sure how you plan to be of service to them.
You decided to join the Harpers? I hope your obligations to them do not interfere with your other work...
Jaheira is capable... she could be a threat to our plans. We should be ready to deal with her should the time come.
Jaheira continues to fight... her resilience is impressive.
Jaheira's retirement is advantageous for us. She could have been a threat to our plans.
Jaheira has earned a rest. She has had a hand in more events of consequence than most.
Gale is making good use of his freedom... and he has adopted a healthy balance of ambition and realism.
I've given it some thought, and I changed my mind. But we need to think bigger with our plans.
I've given it some thought, and I changed my mind. But we need to think bigger with our plans.
What did you have in mind?
It is good to see that Halsin's community is doing well - just as ours is.
The Guild is still hoarding illithid technology recovered from the battle. As illithids, we could put those items to far better use than them... and it would give us a significant advantage.
The Guild is still hoarding illithid technology recovered from the battle. Taking those items from them would give us a significant advantage.
However, it would be worth trading our alliance for them.
We should discuss this with the Guild when we return home. I would prefer a peaceful means of obtaining this technology...
The Zhentarim is still hoarding illithid technology recovered from the battle. As illithids, we could put those items to far better use than them... and it would give us a significant advantage.
The Zhentarim is still hoarding illithid technology recovered from the battle. Taking those items would give us a significant advantage.

Why don't we just mess with Minsc's mind and force him to give them to us?

It would be more reliable to work directly with the Guild - either through mental or social means.
We cannot anticipate how he will react. We don't know where his loyalties lie.
This is the perfect chance to assert our mental authority over them.
This is the perfect chance to assert our mental authority over them.

Very well... we will bide our time for now. None will know how to use that technology - it is likely that it will still be available to us in the future.
Illithid technology is worth far more than an alliance with an inferior organization.
There must be something we can offer them in return.
There must be something we can offer them in return.
I agree. A prize like that is worth such measures.
Ordinarily, I would be tempted to negotiate. But illithid technology is too valuable to lose.
We can begin with dealmaking... but we will use force if they do not see reason.
The Knights is too young to risk attracting the full strength of our enemies. We should wait until we have more leverage over them.
The Knights is too young to risk attracting the full strength of our enemies. We should wait until we have more leverage over them.
I disagree. We are capable, and illithid technology will only make us stronger. It is time to assert our authority.
I would be willing to trade our positions in the Watch Citadel we gained in the reconstruction with them for that technology.
Don't you think they already have enough people in the Watch?
Don't you think they already have enough people in the Watch?

There is always more information to trade with in the city's underworld.
That's a good idea. We should arrange a meeting when we return home.
That's a good idea. We should arrange a meeting when we return home.
I'm glad you agree.
Why give them anything? We are illithid; we should force them to give us what we want.
Why give them anything? You are illithid; you should force them to give us what we want.
I suppose you're right... let's do it.
The Knights is too young to give up such valuable intelligence or to risk antagonizing the other organizations. We should let the technology be for now.
But... there is something we have yet to try...
I suppose consuming him here, away from his sanctuary, would be wise. Save some for me... if he is not too delicious.
What a fine harvest this will be.

I had my first real dream last night. I'm not sure what all the excitement about those is - it was just a bunch of sheep in a field.
That is quite the benign introduction. Don't worry - dreams contain shapes and colors we have no words for. They will fascinate you, with time.
I'm not interested in running the Knights, but I still want to be with you.
I'm not interested in running the Knights, but I still want to be with you.
I'm pleased to hear that, dear.
Our reach extends across the Coast. Xanathar's does not.

We are still young. Thralls are not necessary at this point.

This is a surprise. I didn't know you liked pets.
This is a surprise. I didn't know you liked pets.

I would love that! Let's look into getting one when we return home.
I would love that! Let's look into getting one when we return home.
Thank you, love. That means a lot to me.
Sorry, but I don't like dogs.
Sorry, but I don't like dogs.
Absolutely not. We don't need an excitable animal running around.

No! I would never do that.

As an illithid, my mind is more powerful than yours. Its design is to dominate you.
I wouldn't do so intentionally, but illithids have been known to passively influence those around them.
Accidentally altering or subjugating your mind is a real possibility - from the passion of a joining to the simplicity of my presence, you will be in danger.

Yes... unfortunately, such cases are seldom documented. Our peoples do not traditionally interact in mutually beneficial settings.

I wanted this. I know that my life has changed, and I'm okay with that.

Good.

*The six months since the Netherbrain's fall have seen you and the Emperor travel the Realms. All realities are open to you.*
*You revel in your shared freedom. It is everything you ever dreamed of.*
*Your current outing is abnormally mundane - relieve a town of nearby bandits. You only take such paltry tasks when food is scarce.*
*As your latest meal falls from your maw, it is seized by an otherwordly green glow. It rises, head slumped, mouth agape.*
*As the Emperor's latest meal falls from its maw, the corpse is seized by an otherwordly green glow. It rises, head slumped, mouth agape.*
*'Challengers of Gods,' it groans. 'Surely thou wishest a reprieve from the dark? To reflect and ruminate in the familiar?'*
*You must now make a new journey. Not one of danger, but one of pleasure. To a reunion of allies that stood with you against the Absolute.*
*Even illithid adventurers need rest. What better place for it then the spot where the adventure that changed your lives began?*
*All adventurers need rest, even ones as capable as you. What better place for it then the spot where the adventure that changed your lives began?*
*When the invitation came, you were dodging a hail of Spinagon spines as the Emperor prepared to shred the minds of your assailants.*
*Cutting through the cackling baatezu, sizzling flames, and howling damned came a soothing voice - Withers.*
*He offered you a reprieve from the Blood War. Respite. A night in Faerûn, shared with the allies that stood with you against the Absolute.*
*A reprieve from the Blood War, a few hours of respite with the stars above, and good company to cheer you.*
*Your heart can take the strain of leaving Avernus for a few short hours - and those will be all the sweeter with the Emperor at your side.*

*The tension dissipates - your companions begin to relax. You feel the warmth of their relief, their joy, their peace in each other's company.*
What of Karlach? I cannot lay eyes on her...
Their concerns are so trifling, are they not?
Now, Karlach - Boo still shivers from the sea. May he toast himself against your... Karlach? Where has she gone?
There's only room for one mind flayer here. Eat its brain.
*This is the end of the line - the threshold where the others cannot follow. And you have no choice but to walk it - alone.*
She's taking the long route back to camp. Her time with us is running short - no doubt she's many thoughts to get in order.
*For all its terrors, you missed it. Baldur's Gate is not a bad place for a vampire to live, to flourish. And flourish you will.*
Stop this right now. You have a life ahead of you - don't waste it!
I fear her time is running short...
Our mind flayer acquaintance has wandered off. Not feeling quite herself, perhaps... Understandable.
*It's hard to say what your companions make of you now; their faces betray only confusion. Though one face is notably missing - Karlach.*
*A new quiet settles. Without the blazing Hells inside you, you can finally rest. And listen for the new voice - the quieter voice - that sounds from within.*
*It's hard to say how you find shelter, but you manage it. Now all that's left to do is wait for the familiar embrace of night.*
Whatever it is, you deserve it.
Whatever it is, you deserve it.
I'm - not sure. She's been through quite the ordeal. Perhaps she's in camp...
To business, then. We have much to discuss...
*And just like that, it's over. Whatever's left of you is subsumed by the overwhelming strength of your desires.*
You are depravity compounded on depravity. You cannot be allowed to live. Take your own life.
What happened to Karlach...?
To camp, says Boo! She may have slipped into a new skin, but her scent still singes my hamster's nose.
*Your skin now itches insufferably, as if covered in biting ants. You look, but see nothing out of the ordinary. Until...*
Look at you. You're glorious. The greatest ally I could have wished for.
What are you doing?! Stop it!
Hold on - where's Karlach?
You are strong. You defeated a Netherbrain. Surely you can defeat the Lord of Murder?
You are strong. You defeated a Netherbrain. Surely you can defeat the Lord of Murder?
Don't do this - your life...
It is as it should be. I hope you find peace.
Back to camp. She will not have much time.
*Blood. Blood. Blood. Blood. Blood.*
*Even now, your desires threaten to consume you. Your only hope is that a prison will be sufficient to contain you while you spend the rest of your life pondering your sins.*
She is measuring out the last moments of her life. We should find her, and say our goodbyes.
No doubt she needs a moment alone with her thoughts. Who wouldn't, after all she's been through?
Wait. Where's Karlach?
Perhaps she's retired to camp? She has had a long day.
She returned to camp to rest - and to consider her fate. I fear Karlach is not long for this world.
*You may have freed the world from the control of the Netherbrain, but you are not yet free.*
*You can make it 'til dawn. If you gather every bit of strength you have, you can survive the night. One last night to say goodbye. One last night to live.*
She said she needed some time to herself, and she'd meet us at camp. I'm not sure she's going to last much longer...
Don't do it, my tentacled friend!
Don't do it, friend!
*You've butchered so many before - each death a gift to your Father. But this one, you will take from him. This one is just for you.*
*Her time is running short, and so too is your window to say goodbye.*
I think it might be time for you to find a shadier spot, my friend. If I'm not mistaken, you're beginning to burn...
*Your Father is angry. What foul punishment awaits you now that you have rejected him?*
*You disobeyed the Lord of Murder. But his hold on you remains... It gnaws... You are hungry.*
Hold a moment - where is Karlach?
Astarion - you're starting to crisp up! Get out of the sun!
She has already lost her body to the tadpole... I hope she has not lost her mind. We should find her.
Oh no - Astarion, you're burning up. Take cover, quickly!
She's wandered off... Perhaps she just needs some time alone.
*But it seems your Father has other ideas.*
*Your destiny is set. Your very blood shall clot with the Urge, and that hungry desire will consume you.*
You go ahead. I want to do some good in the world.
*This is it. With the mind flayer's parasite dead, your time in the sun is over.*
*It's not as if you're doing anything wrong. Just following nature's plan.*
If you change your mind... you know where to find me.
What do you think you're doing?
*You can make it 'til dawn. If you gather every bit of strength you have, you can survive the night. One last night to say goodbye. One last night to live.*
You know, this partnership doesn't have to end here... you and I could do wonderful things...
Hold on - we're a body short. Where's Karlach?
She must be at camp. I think she was getting a little too hot under the collar.
Astarion - the sun is burning you. To shelter, quick!
What are you doing!? STOP! You are worthy of life!
Missive from the Emperor

Karlach,

I am pleased to hear of your continued well-being. I regret to inform you that I will not be attending your gathering of allies. Know, however, that I think of you often and am still grateful for the time we shared together.

It brings me great joy to hear that you are making progress on stabilizing your heart. I have every confidence that you will be successful - your tenacity carried us to success against the Netherbrain, and I know it will see you through this. My influence has grown considerably since you left for Avernus; should the need arise, I would be happy to connect you with aid for your campaign.

Be merry with your allies tonight - fill your life with the joy it deserves. When your heart is ready, please consider visiting me. I would greatly enjoy exchanging tales of our respective endeavors - not as allies, but as friends.

My home is ever open to you.
The Emperor

My companion,

I am pleased to hear of your continued well-being. I must admit that putting pen to paper is a pleasant novelty to cover the distance between our minds. I regret to inform you that I will not be attending your gathering of allies. Know, however, that I meant what I said when we parted - I think of you often and am still grateful for the time we shared together.

My life continues much as it did before we met. I am quickly moving to restore my authority, and I anticipate opportunities to collaborate should present themselves shortly. When they do, I hope you will heed my call. Ours was a beneficial partnership, and further collaboration will only benefit us both.

Be merry with your allies tonight - fill your life with the joy it deserves. And once the festivities conclude, please consider visiting me. I would greatly enjoy exchanging tales of our respective endeavors - not as allies, but as friends.

My home is ever open to you.
The Emperor

Missive from the Emperor

What if I come with you? With your fury enhanced by an illithid's power, you would be untouchable.
Can you come with me? With your help, I could make it through. I could survive.
No way, squiddie. You don't deserve the Hells. I'll go alone.
Oh... I see. Very welll.

No way, squiddie. You don't deserve the Hells.

No. I'm not damning us to that pit.

I... I respect your decision. I will stay by your side until the end.
Thanks, squiddie. I need to go outside... and breathe.
When you eat a brain, you absorb its memories, right? If I'm going to die anyway, you should eat mine. You'll never be alone again.
All tadpoles here in the city were destroyed when the brain died, and it is unlikely that the cultists left any in Moonrise.
Thanks, squiddie. I need to go outside... and breathe.
FRIENDS!!
You seem to be enjoying the party, Us.
You seem to be enjoying the party, Us.
Hey, Us! I'm glad you came.

Keep it down! You're embarassing us.

Pet it.
Leave.
Leave.
Does it feel good to not have to keep your cat disguise up?
Does it feel good to not have to keep your cat disguise up?
Are you hungry? Looks like Withers didn't bring any food for us.
Are you hungry? Looks like Withers didn't bring any food for you.
Do not fret for Us! The kitties are even more cunning then we thought... they have taught Us to catch mice! A mouse will be our prey!
Our appearance is not important to Us... but it is very important to others. We are happy to be around those who differ from that opinion.
You love Us! And we love you!

I love you, Empy! I want you to be happy.

We could step away from the party for a moment if this socializing is tiring you out.

You are too important to me to risk destroying. I'm sorry, but...

I must distance myself from you for your own protection.

So this is it? This is where we part ways?
You're throwing away everything we had?
I'll miss you, Emperor.
Do not fear - we will see each other again. What will you do until then?

To work then, my friend. Come - I have so much to show you.
Your ambition is a wonder to behold, my friend. Come - I have so much to show you.

As illithids, this Coast is ready for our dominion. We will rule from the shadows as allies, not romantic partners.

Us
Volo's embellishments are excessive. Before my transformation, I might have approved of them... now, I see them for the nonsense they are.
Volo's tall tales will distract the public from our real plans. It is best to humor him.
Ignore the tressym. I pity her short-sightedness.
The tressym has a certain... air to her thoughts...

Jaheira is capable... she could be a threat to our plans. We should be ready to deal with her should the time come.
You decided to join the Harpers? I hope your obligations to them do not interfere with your other work...

You decided to join the Harpers? An interesting strategy... I suppose it will be good to have a foothold in such a powerful organization.
They expect the Absolute's forces to be eradicated... if they find that not only have they survived but are rebuilding their lives, they will respond with violence.
Halsin's community building reminds me of my own, all those years ago...
Halsin's community remains a problem for us. I fear their expansion into Moonrise will reveal our subterranean colony.
It is good to see that Halsin's community is doing well - just as ours is.
Minthara is a skilled tactician. Her clash with Menzoberranzan will be informative, regardless of if it ends in her victory or not.
Minthara will likely have a role in our extension to Menzoberranzan. Whether she will be our ally or adversary... that will be up to her.
Minthara would have been a significant adversary had we chosen to run the Knights. I admire her skill.
Minthara... another player in Baldur's Gate. We should take her authority seriously. She could challenge our rule if we are not careful.
Helping Astarion is a strategic move. We have the resources to spare, and in return we would gain his allyship.

Helping Astarion is a strategic move. I have the resources to spare, and in return I would gain his allyship.
I'm glad you decided to help Astarion. It should be an enjoyable excursion for us.

It is good to hear that Astarion's community is doing as well as ours. Perhaps we could collaborate on a food source...
It is good to hear that Astarion's community is doing well. I did not expect Astarion to be a capable leader, but he proved me wrong.
It seems Astarion is taking full advantage of his freedom - just as we are.
Lae'zel has seized her future - no longer is she any monarch's pawn. I'm proud of her.
I'm glad you decided to help Lae'zel. We should bring some illithids from the colony to help us preserve brains.
Our organization cannot afford to get tied up in githyanki politics, so unfortunately we will need to take on the outpost Lae'zel found alone.
I'm glad you decided to help Lae'zel. Fighting githyanki is always thrilling.
That githyanki outpost Lae'zel mentioned would be a good source of food for the colony. We should consider helping her attack it.
I'm glad you have not committed to helping Lae'zel raid that githyanki outpost. Our organization cannot get involved in interstellar politics.
We should consider helping Lae'zel attack that githyanki outpost. It would be a thrilling adventure.
So... Lae'zel accomplished her dream - to serve the githyanki queen to her end. A purpose similar to those of illithids living under elder brains.
Though unlike them, this was her choice. I'm happy for her.
Karlach... a light of hope in a wicked world.
Needlessly cryptic, as ever...
We should maintain our relationship with Wyll - having leverage with someone of his power could greatly help us.
We should maintain our relationship with Wyll - having leverage with someone of his power could greatly help the Knights.
Wyll is idealistic... I hope that does not hinder him from exercising his authority as he should.
It was kind of Wyll to travel to Avernus with Karlach. Caring for those close to you is a respectable trait.
Wyll's sense of duty to the commoner seems as strong as ever. I hope he is more judicious with his target selections now, though...
So, Minsc is the one guarding the illithid technology... we will need to find a way past him if the Guild does not agree to let us have it.
Minsc continues to get himself into trouble. I'm glad our alliance with him proved more fruitful then getting us captured.
It is good to see Shadowheart enjoying her freedom. She deserves a peaceful life after everything she went through.
It is good to see Shadowheart enjoying her freedom. I hope Selûne treats her better than Shar did.
Shadowheart's devotion to her people is commendable... but deities are selfish beings undeserving of such blind worship.
While Gale's ambition is admirable, his reward has only inflated his arrogance. He seems to have learned little from his mistakes.
I am pleased to see that Gale has settled into a comfortable life. The dissemination of knowledge suits him.
Gale is making good use of his freedom... and he has adopted a healthy balance of ambition and realism.
I am relieved to see Karlach enjoying her new form. She deserves all the wonders illithidness offers.
Karlach did not deserve a return to Avernus... but I'm glad she is not alone. And the news that her heart might not be beyond repair is a relief.
They are better equipped to inform you of the details. Please enjoy the party.
Hello, my friend. It is good to see you again. Since our victory, my partner and I have enjoyed a fruitful and mutually beneficial life together.
Some echoes do indeed reverberate for eternity...
That you did so willingly is... astounding.
Karlach... I wish I could. Unfortunately, it is not as simple as a matter of want.
I will not make Avernus more dangerous than it already is. I will not destroy you.
So that's it? You would throw everything we had away based on what might happen? As smart as you are, you can't tell the future!
Alright. Please calm yourself... don't stress your engine.
Squiddie, your strength would be aimed at fiends and those things are tiring. I don't think you'd have energy to hurt me.

I am discarding nothing. I am protecting you. You are more than capable of braving the Hells alone.

I can't do it. I won't.

Good. I will see you off. Remember - this is not goodbye. We will see each other again.

I eagerly await the opportunity to sample him - he must have quite the unique taste.

His demeaning comments on your form are despicable. He may be a vampire, yet he is blinded by privilege.
